application.doc: Retrieving the current list of SCIM Custom Schema Extensions

param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieve all SCIM Custom Schema Extensions
method.doc: To complete this operation with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the Verify Identity Access SCIM Custom Schema Extensions resource URI.

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

param.name: message
param.doc: The error message.

response.doc: File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

param.name: message
param.doc: The error message.

response.doc: An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

param.name: message
param.doc: The error message.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

representation.name: Custom Schema Extension
representation.doc: Note: Response body is an array.

param.name: id
param.doc: The URN of the custom schema extension. This is the key that will be present in the SCIM User Payload.

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of the custom schema extension.

param.name: description
param.doc: A description of the custom schema extension.

param.name: attributes
param.doc: The list of custom attributes.

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of the custom attribute.

param.name: description
param.doc: A description of the custom attribute.

param.name: type
param.doc: The type of the attribute. Can be one of: string, boolean, decimal, integer, dateTime, reference, complex (object), binary.

param.name: multiValued
param.doc: Whether or not the attribute is an array or singular.

param.name: required
param.doc: Whether or not the attribute is required.

param.name: mutability
param.doc: Indicates whether or not an attribute is modifiable. Can be one of: readOnly, readWrite, immutable, writeOnly, adminWrite, userWrite.

param.name: returned
param.doc: Indicates when an attribute is returned in a response (e.g., to a query). Can be one of: always, never, default, request.

param.name: canonicalValues
param.doc: A collection of canonical values. Enforced when the user is modified in a POST/PATCH/PUT request.

param.name: mapping
param.doc: The mapping of this attribute to either LDAP, Session, or Fixed values. Must be included if type is not "complex".

param.name: subAttributes
param.doc: The list of custom sub-attributes. Must be included if type is "complex".

param.name: sourceType
param.doc: The type of the source to fetch this custom attribute from. Can be one of: ldap, session, fixed.

param.name: sourceAttribute
param.doc: The name of the LDAP or Session attribute to source the attribute value from, or the fixed value, depending on the source type.

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of the custom attribute.

param.name: description
param.doc: A description of the custom attribute.

param.name: type
param.doc: The type of the attribute. Can be one of: string, boolean, decimal, integer, dateTime, reference, complex (object), binary.

param.name: multiValued
param.doc: Whether or not the attribute is an array or singular.

param.name: required
param.doc: Whether or not the attribute is required.

param.name: mutability
param.doc: Indicates whether or not an attribute is modifiable. Can be one of: readOnly, readWrite, immutable, writeOnly, adminWrite, userWrite.

param.name: returned
param.doc: Indicates when an attribute is returned in a response (e.g., to a query). Can be one of: always, never, default, request.

param.name: canonicalValues
param.doc: A collection of canonical values. Enforced when the user is modified in a POST/PATCH/PUT request.

param.name: mapping
param.doc: The mapping of this attribute to either LDAP, Session, or Fixed values. Must be included if type is not "complex".
